summary: Our sources say folks who have the means to buy expensive mansions like Ben and J Lo's are looking for real estate deals right now ... and at the current price, we're told this place is far from a steal. L.A. was hit hard by wildfires in January -- with entire neighborhoods wiped out -- and fire insurance prices are skyrocketing ... so much so that we're told the estimated insurance cost for Ben and J Lo's place is an eye-popping $500,000 a year, which is turning would-be buyers away. Multiple realtors tell TMZ the $68 million asking price is way too high ... with several agents going so far as to say Ben and J Lo need to drop the price at least 15% if they hope to sell.
